subject: No runnable methods in parameterized test class
msgSnippet: I m new to JUnit 4 and am trying to use it to create some parameterized tests. I have written nonparameterized simplified sample versions of my tests, and I ve
messageBody:
I'm new to JUnit 4 and am trying to use it to create some parameterized
tests.
I have written nonparameterized simplified sample versions of my tests,
and I've gotten them to work in JUnit 4. I've found several examples of
parameterized tests online, and emulated them in converting my
nonparameterized sample tests to parameterized ones.

When I run the test class from within NetBeans, I get output for each of
the test methods the correct number of times, but in each case, the
output is an "error", indicating no runnable methods.

There is one peculiar thing about my situation, which is that I am using
ActiWATE to test my web application (acceptance testing, not really unit
testing). ActiWATE is a library of extensions to JUnit 3 that adds
utilities, objects, and assertions for testing the web UI. Most of the
methods I want to use are in the ActiwateTestCase class, which extends
TestCase. I know that JUnit 4 recognizes extensions of TestCase and
takes that as the cue to treat the test as a JUnit 3 test. So, instead,
I simply instantiate a subclass of ActiwateTestCaseand use its methods
within my Junit test.

With the nonparameterized version of my test class, this all seems to
work in JUnit 4, recognizing the annotations and successfully calling
the ActiwateTestCase methods (much to my surprise). But when I
parameterize the test class, I get "No runnable methods" errors for each
test method.

I thought maybe it was not liking my shell of an ActiwateTestCase, but I
commented out all the code related to it, and still the same problem.
So that's probably a red herring.


Here's the JUnit output when I run this in NetBeans 6.0.1:

No test passed, 12 tests caused an error.

actiwate.junit4.com.quest.nichols.genetics_rd.kaiser.CalculatorRequestPa
geTest1
FAILED
displayCalculatorResultPage[0] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
again[0] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
noUseOfActiWATE[0] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
displayCalculatorResultPage[1] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
again[1] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
noUseOfActiWATE[1] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
displayCalculatorResultPage[2] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
again[2] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
noUseOfActiWATE[2] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
displayCalculatorResultPage[3] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
again[3] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception
noUseOfActiWATE[3] caused an ERROR (0.0s)
No runnable methods
java.lang.Exception

Can anyone see any obvious problems with this code?


package actiwate.junit4.com.quest.nichols.genetics_rd.kaiser;

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;


import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;
import static org.junit.Assert.*;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;

import com.actimind.actiwate.testing.ActiwateTestCase;
import com.actimind.actiwate.testing.html.objects.*;


/**
*
* @author rebeccah.h.prastein
*/
@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public class CalculatorResultPageTest1
{
private String[][] setupData;
private Map setupDataMap = new HashMap();
private ActiwateTestCase atc = new ActiwateTestCase(){};

@Parameters
public static Collection data()
{
String[][][] kaiserPatientsSetupData =
ActiWATEPrep.getKaiserPatientsSetupData();
return Arrays.asList(kaiserPatientsSetupData);
}

public CalculatorResultPageTest1(String[][] setupData)
{
this.setupData = setupData;
for (int i=0; i < setupData.length; i++)
{
setupDataMap.put(setupData[i][0], setupData[i][1]);
}
}

@Before
public void callCalculator()
{
displayCalculatorResultPage();
}

@Test
public void displayCalculatorResultPage()
{
/*
Write the code that opens initial HTML page. Tests can use
relative
URLs. Base URL is specified in configuration file (see
Configuration
file).
*/

atc.goTo("webcalculator.html");


/*Write the code that verifies whether the form is successfully
displayed. */
atc.assertTextPresent("NT measurement from twin B");
atc.assertTextNotPresent("errors entering the patient data:");
Button submitButton = atc.buttonByText("calculate revised
risks");
assertNotNull("Submit button not found on web claculator form
page", submitButton);

/*Write the code that fills in the form*/
/*Write the code that submits the form*/
/*Write the code that checks the results page.*/
}

@Test
public void again()
{
//OK, for this one, since we're not actually clicking through to
the
//response page, all of the text field values are empty strings.
//So, let's compare it against some arbitrary expected output,
say the
//response code. I'll create setupData with empty strings and
with
//nonempty strings for RESPONSE_CODE.
//I should get a test repetition for each one, with successes
and
//failures vs until the first failure?

//Unfortunately, actiwate doesn't provide any way to access the
response headers.
TextField dob =
atc.textField(ActiWATEPrep.CalculatorInput.dob.toString
());
String dobValue = dob.value();
String expectedResponseCode =

(String)setupDataMap.get(ActiWATEPrep.ExpectedCalculatorOutput.
RESPONSE_CODE.toString());
assertEquals(dobValue, expectedResponseCode);
}

@Test
public void noUseOfActiWATE()
{
String dobValue = "";
String expectedResponseCode =

(String)setupDataMap.get(ActiWATEPrep.ExpectedCalculatorOutput.
RESPONSE_CODE.toString());
assertEquals(dobValue, expectedResponseCode);
}

}



Thanks,

Rebeccah
